snippet: Mr. Shamir was part of a group of right-wing politicians who rose to power in the 1970s and who adopted an unyielding opposition to territorial concessions for Palestinians.
abstract: Yitzhak Shamir, former Israeli prime minister and militia leader who promoted a muscular Zionism and expansive settlement in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip, dies at age 96.

byline.contributor: Ethan Bronner and Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Shamir was part of a group of right-wing politicians who rose to power in the 1970s and who adopted an unyielding opposition to territorial concessions for Palestinians.

headline.seo: Yitzhak Shamir, Former Prime Minister, Dies at 96
headline.main: Yitzhak Shamir, Former Israeli Prime Minister, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: Yitzhak Shamir, Former Israeli Prime Minister and Militia Leader, Dies at 96
